We need to get one for our project and I'd appreciate any opinions people
have as to which tools are out there, that do the job well.

Cheers

Andy

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Shane Duan [mailto:sduan@...]
> Sent: 19 March 2003 08:47
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] Memory Leak in JUnit?
>
>
> It is really hard to imagine that JUnit can cause that much memory just
> because it is calculating the time elapse.
>
> I'd suggest you create a suite that runs only limited tests.  Change the
> number of the tests until you don't get the out of memory error any more
> but still get a large of memory usage.  The put a break point at the end
> of the test and use optimizeit to check the newly allocated instances.
>
> Hope that helps.
>
> Shane
>
> Vladimir R. Bossicard wrote:
>
> >>Tracing the allocation chain in the original version
> >>(targeted at 1.3) showed this distribution of allocations:
> >> %   in
> >>---  ------
> >>44%  junit.textui.ResultPrinter.elapsedTimeAsString()
> >>2.5% junit.textui.ResultPrinter.printeDefect()
> >>2.5% junit.textui.TestRunner.createTestResult()
> >>2.0% junit.textui.TestRunner.junit.textui.TestRunner()
> >>     (huh????)
> >>
> >>
>
